intro: Astronium candollei, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically harvested when they turn yellow or red, depending on the variety. Astronium candollei is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its fruit, which has a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
